items.title: Manchester City v Exeter, Sheffield Wednesday v Brentford, and more: FA Cup third round ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Updates from Saturday‚Äôs afternoon kick-offs ‚öΩ Live scores | Read Football Daily | Mail Tom Arokodare added another in added-time, apologies I missed that in thee excitement at Macclesfield and Everton. Yeremy Pino makes the six minutes of injury time interesting with a decent free-kick that gets up and over the wall. Can Macclesfield hang on? Continue reading...

items.title: Algeria v Nigeria: Africa Cup of Nations 2025 quarter-final ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Updates from the last-eight tie; kick-off 4pm GMT ‚öΩ Live scores | Read Football Daily | Mail Xaymaca 12 min: Algeria are getting a foothold in the game now. The midfield four string together a few passes neatly before the Nigeria defence cut it out. 9 min: There‚Äôs more early pressure from Nigeria. Frank Onyeka meets a cross on the volley but he struggles to hit it with any conviction. Algeria clear the ball off the line. Continue reading...

items.title: Strand Larsen scores hat-trick as Wolves thrash Shrewsbury
items.summary: Striker Jorgen Strand Larsen's hat-trick ends his Wolves goal drought as he fires them past League Two Shrewsbury into the FA Cup fourth round.

items.title: PSV voegt specialist voor spelhervattingen toe aan technische staf
items.summary: PSV voegt Kevin Balvers toe aan de technische staf als specialist voor de spelhervattingen. Het is een functie die nog niet bestond bij de landskampioen.

items.title: VI Live: Mijnans tekent voor eerste Eredivisie-treffer van 2026
items.summary: Zaterdag wordt de Eredivisie weer hervat. Er staan vier wedstrijden op het programma. Daarnaast is er volop voetbal in het buitenland. In deze VI Live blijf je op de hoogte van de belangrijkste verrichtingen in binnen- en buitenland.

items.title: VI Live: PSV en Excelsior leven toe naar hervatting van Eredivisie
items.summary: Zaterdag om 20.00 uur hervat PSV de Eredivisie. De koploper krijgt om 20.00 uur bezoek van Excelsior. In deze VI Live blijf je volledig op de hoogte van die wedstrijd.

items.title: Alonso to 'assess the risk' on Mbappe fitness
items.summary: Xabi Alonso said Real Madrid will "assess the risk" of playing Kylian Mbapp√© in Sunday's Supercopa final with Barcelona, with the star forward racing to recover from a knee sprain.

items.title: Glasner fileert Crystal Palace na blamage, familie Rooney vol trots
items.summary: Crystal Palace-manager Oliver Glasner had geen goed woord over voor zijn elftal na de blamage in de FA Cup tegen Macclesfield FC , uitkomend op het zesde niveau in Engeland. Zijn Macclesfield-collega John Rooney was vol ongeloof, net als zijn broer Wayne Rooney, die als BBC Sport-analist bij de wedstrijd was.

items.title: FA Cup roundup: Sunderland beat Everton on penalties as Strand Larsen hits treble for Wolves
items.summary: Wolves beat Shrewsbury 6-1 to continue revival Leicester win 2-0 at Cheltenham to avoid giantkilling Everton‚Äôs first FA Cup tie at Hill Dickinson Stadium ended in a penalty shootout loss to Sunderland, with all of the home team‚Äôs takers failing with their kicks. Enzo Le F√©e had put his midweek penalties woes behind him by scoring the opener for Sunderland, only for a late penalty, a softish award given after Adam Aznou‚Äôs shoulder-to-shoulder challenge from Trai Hume, to send the game into extra time after a 1-1 draw. James Garner scored that kick but missed in the shootout while Le F√©e converted his, this time avoiding the panenka. When Thierno Barry and Beto also missed for Everton, Luke O‚ÄôNien was left to slot the winning kick. This story will be updated Continue reading...

items.title: Martens had 'pittig gesprek' met Kwakman na streep door huurdeal
items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Manchester United frustrate Arsenal in WSL after Jayde Riviere sees red
items.summary: Manchester City and Chelsea were the real winners, as Arsenal and Manchester United played out a goalless draw and lost further ground in the title race. United played the final 25 minutes with 10 players after Jayde Riviere was sent off for a second bookable offence, a late challenge on Caitlin Foord, but United were able to see out the remainder of the game without succumbing to Arsenal‚Äôs late pressure. It means Manchester City could be 10 points better off than third-placed Arsenal by the end of the weekend ‚Äì City play Everton on Sunday ‚Äì while Manchester United are a point further behind. With 10 games remaining for Arsenal, that sort of deficit feels significant. Continue reading...

items.title: Sources: Man United aim for boss clarity next week
items.summary: Manchester United are hoping to have clarity on who will lead the team for the rest of the season early next week, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Macclesfield beat holders Palace in FA Cup shock
items.summary: Non-league Macclesfield pulled off one of the biggest-ever FA Cup upsets as they knocked out holders Crystal Palace in a remarkable 2-1 win at the third-round stage.

items.title: Parkinson revels as Wrexham pass 'next stage'
items.summary: Phil Parkinson believes knocking Nottingham Forest out of the FA Cup will help Wrexham's push to play Premier League teams on an equal footing.

items.title: Rosenior: Chelsea can equal Man Utd 'class of 92'
items.summary: Liam Rosenior believes Chelsea can emulate Manchester United's fabled 'Class of '92' as they pursue a policy of targeting silverware with young players.

items.title: Non-league Macclesfield stun FA Cup holders Crystal Palace
items.summary: Sixth-tier Macclesfield FC beat reigning champions Crystal Palace. With 117 places between the teams, it's the biggest upset in FA Cup history.

items.title: Macclesfield fans invade the pitch after beating Palace
items.summary: The Macclesfield fans invade the pitch after beating last season's FA Cup winners Crystal Palace, in the biggest upset in FA Cup history.

items.title: Macclesfield pull off FA Cup‚Äôs greatest shock by knocking out holders Crystal Palace
items.summary: Macclesfield etched themselves into the FA Cup history books by pulling off arguably the greatest giantkilling of all time, as they stunned Crystal Palace, the holders, in front of a disbelieving and delirious Moss Rose crowd. Despite 117 places in the English football pyramid separating the sides, Palace became the first holders to crash out to non-league opposition since 1909. Palace were a shadow of the side that romped to Cup success last season ‚Äì the club‚Äôs first major trophy ‚Äì despite including three of that Wembley lineup. They were picked apart by John Rooney‚Äôs inspired Macclesfield, spearheaded by Paul Dawson, their captain. His header set the upset in motion before half-time, with Isaac Buckley-Ricketts scoring a scrappy second on the hour mark. Continue reading...

items.title: Strand Larsen scores hat-trick as Wolves thump League Two Shrews to progress
items.summary: Jorgen Strand Larsen netted a hat-trick as Wolves eased to a 6-1 thrashing over League Two Shrewsbury to book their spot in the fourth round of the Emirates FA Cup.

items.title: Roefs saves every Everton pen as Sunderland progress in FA Cup shootout
items.summary: Robin Roefs was Sunderland's hero as Everton's FA Cup hopes came to a premature end once again after three woeful penalties in a shootout saw the Black Cats reach round four.
